page.title: 01General Description
page.content: This block straddles the river Ouse which is like a spine flowing roughly from West to East. The river has always moulded the character of the area, sometimes as a means of transport or a source of power for mills but now as a leisure resource for fishing and boating. The buildings in the area reflect this, representing Tudor thatch to the modern boat marina. The industry today is light, such as printing, packaging and plastics. Some of it is connected with hi-tech electronics. There is also a great increase in the number of people commuting to London and Cambridge as road and rail services have developed. The area is becoming a cross roads for many major trunk routes but St Ives cattle market has gone. All this reflects the vast social changes taking place.
